text:
Summary:
Certain AlphaComposites will cause SVGGraphics2D to fail.

Code:
SVGGraphics2D g = ...;
g.setComposite(AlphaComposite.getInstance(AlphaComposite.DST_ATOP));


Description:

Batik uses org.apache.batik.svggen.SVGAlphaComposite to represent 
AlphaComposite in SVG output. SVGAlphaComposite supports only a subset of 
possible AlphaComposites, namely SRC, SRC_IN, SRC_OUT, DST_IN, DST_OUT, 
DST_OVER, CLEAR.
It does not support SRC_ATOP, DST_ATOP, XOR.

If any of the unused AlphaComposites are used, then exception is thrown as 
shown below.

It appears that the composites in question were simply forgotten when a map of 
AlphaComposite filter definitions is initialized (compositeDefsMap). It should 
be fairly easy to fix this.

Exception thrown:
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.apache.batik.svggen.SVGAlphaComposite.toSVG(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.batik.svggen.SVGComposite.toSVG(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.batik.svggen.SVGComposite.toSVG(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.batik.svggen.SVGGraphicContextConverter.toSVG(Unknown 
Source)
        at org.apache.batik.svggen.DOMGroupManager.addElement(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.batik.svggen.SVGGraphics2D.fill(Unknown Source)
creator: toly@intellidos.com
deweese@apache.org

Reassigning all open bugs to the development list.
Sorry for the mass mailing.
